title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8112.00 - General
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17 ยง 8112.00 - General

State Regulations
(a) Route 8. The
northbound and southbound roadways of Route 8, between the Otsego county line
and IR 88 (including all ramps), a distance of 1.6+- miles in the Town of

Sidney and Village of Sidney. (b) Route 357. The eastbound and westbound roadways of Route 357 between IR 88 and
CR 21, a distance of 6.6+- miles in the Towns of Sidney and Franklin. (c) CR 21. The northbound and southbound
roadways of CR 21 between Route 357 and the northerly Walton village line, a
distance of 12.6+- miles in the Towns of Franklin and Walton. (d) Route 10. The northbound and southbound
roadways of Route 10 between the southerly Walton village line and Route 268, a
distance of 10.0+- miles in the Towns of Walton and Tompkins. (e) Route 268. The northbound and southbound
roadways of Route 268 between Route 10 and Route 990P, a distance of 9.31+-
miles in the Towns of Tompkins and Hancock. (f) [Eff. until July 11, 2001, see also subd. (f) below.] Route 23. Route 23 between the Otsego county line and Southside

Drive, a distance of 1.6+- miles in the Town of Davenport. (f) [Eff. July 11, 2001, see also subd. (f)
above.] [Repealed]
(g) Route 23. Route 23 between the Delaware-Greene county line and the Delaware-Schoharie
county line in the Town of Roxbury. (h) Route 23. Route 23 between the

Delaware-Schoharie county line and the Delaware-Otsego county line in the Towns
of Stamford, Harpersfield, Kortright and Davenport. (i) Route 28. Route 28 between the

Delaware-Ulster county line and the Delaware-Otsego county line in the Towns of

Middletown, Andes, Bovina, Delhi, Meredith and Franklin and in the Villages of

Fleischmanns, Margaretville, Andes and Delhi. (j) Route 30. Route 30 between Route 17 and
the Delaware-Schoharie county line in the Towns of Hancock, Colchester, Andes, Middletown, Roxbury and in the Village of Margaretville. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 17
ยง
8112.00

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
